sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: flyExclusive (NYSE: FLYX) details 530,381-share resale and dilution risks
feed.summary: flyExclusive (NYSE: FLYX) has registered 530,381 shares of Class A common stock for resale by existing stockholders, which were issued in private placements in October 2025. The company will not receive any proceeds from these sales, and the prospectus highlights significant dilution risks due to this offering and other registered shares, totaling approximately 91% of fully diluted Class A shares. Additionally, a proposed merger involving Jet.AI could lead to further dilution, and flyExclusive does not anticipate paying cash dividends in the foreseeable future.

feed.title: Volato (NYSE: SOAR) sets flyExclusive (FLYX) stock dividend at 0.0348 per share
feed.summary: Volato Group, Inc. (NYSE American: SOAR) announced a stock dividend of flyExclusive, Inc. (NYSE American: FLYX) shares for its shareholders. Record holders as of December 26, 2025, will receive approximately 0.0348 shares of FLYX common stock for each Volato Class A common share held, with cash in lieu of fractional shares. This dividend aims to enhance shareholder value and provide direct participation in flyExclusive's growth.

feed.title: Volato (NYSE: SOAR) sets flyExclusive (FLYX) stock dividend at 0.0348 per share
feed.summary: Volato Group, Inc. (NYSE American: SOAR) announced a stock dividend of flyExclusive, Inc. (NYSE American: FLYX) shares to its shareholders. Volato shareholders of record as of December 26, 2025, will receive approximately 0.0348 shares of flyExclusive common stock for each share of Volato Class A common stock held. This move aims to enhance shareholder value and provide direct participation in flyExclusive, a key partner in the private aviation sector.

feed.title: flyExclusive (NYSE American: FLYX) seeks approval to expand equity and ESPP share reserves
feed.summary: flyExclusive (NYSE American: FLYX) is asking shareholders to approve a significant expansion of its equity compensation programs at a virtual annual meeting on December 30, 2025. The proposals include increasing the 2023 Equity Incentive Plan's share reserve from 6,000,000 to 15,000,000 shares and the Employee Stock Purchase Plan's reserve from 1,500,000 to 2,500,000 shares. The Board unanimously recommends voting FOR all proposals, which also include the election of seven directors and the ratification of Elliott Davis as the independent auditor for 2025.

feed.title: $6-8M profit expected Q4 2025 — flyExclusive acquires Volato sales unit for $2.1M stock
feed.summary: flyExclusive (NYSEAMERICAN: FLYX) has acquired Volato’s aircraft sales division for $2.1 million in stock, a move projected to generate $6-8 million in profit for flyExclusive in Q4 2025. The agreement also includes the option for flyExclusive to acquire Volato's high-growth technology platforms, Vaunt and Mission Control, for an additional $2.0 million in FLYX stock. This strategic transaction aims to enhance flyExclusive's vertical integration and expand its services in the software sector, delivering greater value to both companies' shareholders.

feed.title: flyExclusive narrows losses in second quarter
feed.summary: Private jet operator flyExclusive narrowed its losses by 42% year-over-year to $16.1m in the second quarter, reporting revenue of $91.3m driven by growth in flights and aircraft management services. The company saw an increase in members and active members, with shares surging before the results announcement. flyExclusive is also expanding its services and pursuing strategies to enhance its market presence and capital raising capabilities.

feed.title: flyExclusive releases 5.6m shares, 4.3m warrants to boost public float
feed.summary: flyExclusive has announced an agreement with EG Sponsor to waive the lock-up on 5.6 million shares of Class A common stock and warrants for 4.3 million Class A shares. This move aims to increase the company's public float, facilitating its inclusion in the Russell Indices and supporting its capital-raising efforts. The lock-up, originally set to expire in December 2026, has been in effect for over 18 months since the company's merger with EG Acquisition Corp in December 2023.

feed.title: flyExclusive Releases Shares of Class A Common Stock and Warrants from Lock-Up Agreement
feed.summary: flyExclusive announced the immediate waiver of a lock-up agreement for 5,625,000 shares of its Class A common stock and warrants to purchase 4,333,333 shares, previously held by EG Sponsor LLC. This strategic move aims to position flyExclusive for inclusion in the Russell Family of Indices, which is expected to enhance shareholder value through increased liquidity and support future capital raising efforts. The original lock-up, in effect for over 18 months since the company's merger with EG Acquisition Corp., was set to expire in December 2026.

feed.title: FlyExclusive releases shares from lock-up agreement
feed.summary: FlyExclusive has released 5,625,000 shares of Class A common stock and warrants to purchase 4,333,333 shares, previously held by EG Sponsor LLC and its affiliates, from a lock-up agreement. This move, agreed upon by EG Sponsor, aims to position FlyExclusive for inclusion in the Russell Indexes, thereby increasing trading volume and liquidity and supporting future capital raising. The company believes this will benefit shareholders and support its growth in the public markets.

feed.title: Jet.AI Stock Soars: Time to Buy?
feed.summary: Jet.AI Inc. is experiencing a stock surge following its announcement of a strategic alliance with a major airline and a pivot away from its aviation division to focus solely on AI solutions. The company is offloading its aviation business to flyExclusive in an all-stock transaction, aiming to refocus on AI data center market. Despite current financial struggles, this strategic shift has generated significant market interest and potential future opportunities, though legal investigations regarding the merger's fairness introduce some uncertainty.

feed.title: flyExclusive to buy Jet.AI’s aviation business
feed.summary: Charter carrier flyExclusive is set to acquire the aviation business of artificial intelligence company Jet.AI, following Jet.AI's spin-out of the business into a new company called SpinCo. This acquisition will provide flyExclusive with additional growth capital and enhanced shareholder liquidity, supporting its 2025 growth plans and market share expansion. Jet.AI shareholders will receive Class A common shares in flyExclusive, allowing Jet.AI to focus on its pure-play AI solutions.

feed.title: JTAI Stock Alert: Halper Sadeh LLC Is Investigating Whether the Sale of Jet.AI Inc. Is Fair to Shareholders
feed.summary: Halper Sadeh LLC, an investor rights law firm, is investigating whether the sale of Jet.AI Inc.'s (NASDAQ: JTAI) aviation business to flyExclusive Inc. is fair to Jet.AI shareholders. The firm is concerned that Jet.AI and its board may have failed to secure the best possible consideration for shareholders and adequately disclose all material information regarding the transaction. Halper Sadeh LLC is encouraging Jet.AI shareholders to contact them to learn about their legal rights and options.

feed.title: flyExclusive to acquire Jet.AI’s aviation business in strategic deal
feed.summary: flyExclusive Inc. has agreed to acquire the aviation division of Jet.AI Inc., which will spin off its aviation business into "SpinCo" before the acquisition. This all-stock deal allows Jet.AI shareholders to retain their existing stock and receive flyExclusive Class A common shares. The acquisition aims to bolster flyExclusive's position in private aviation and expand its market share, while Jet.AI will focus solely on AI solutions.

feed.title: flyExclusive to Acquire Jet.AI’s Aviation Business in All-Stock Deal
feed.summary: flyExclusive Inc. is set to acquire the aviation business of Jet.AI Inc. in an all-stock transaction, transforming Jet.AI into a pure-play AI solutions company. The deal, valued between $12 million and $22 million, aims to provide flyExclusive with growth capital and enhance shareholder liquidity, while allowing Jet.AI to focus on its AI technologies. The transaction is expected to close in Q2 2025, pending regulatory and shareholder approvals, and Jet.AI securing financing.

feed.title: Major Aviation Merger: flyExclusive's $22M Strategic Takeover Reshapes Private Charter Market
feed.summary: flyExclusive (NYSE: FLYX) is set to acquire Jet.AI's (NASDAQ: JTAI) aviation business for $12-22 million in an all-stock deal, transforming Jet.AI into a pure-play AI company. The transaction, expected to close in Q2 2025, involves spinning off Jet.AI's charter business into a new entity which flyExclusive will then acquire, while Jet.AI shareholders will retain their stock and receive new flyExclusive shares. This strategic move aims to provide flyExclusive with growth capital and enhanced shareholder liquidity, leveraging synergies between the two companies.

feed.title: flyExclusive Snaps Up Jet.AI's Aviation Business, Shares Fly Higher
feed.summary: flyExclusive (NYSE: FLYX) has agreed to acquire Jet.AI's (NASDAQ: JTAI) aviation business, allowing Jet.AI to become a pure-play AI company. Jet.AI shareholders will receive new Class A common shares in flyExclusive, and the deal is valued between $12 million and $22 million depending on net cash. This acquisition is expected to boost flyExclusive's growth and is set to close in Q2 2025, pending regulatory approvals and shareholder consent.

feed.title: flyExclusive to acquire Jet.AI in all-stock transaction
feed.summary: Jet charter provider flyExclusive has announced a definitive agreement to acquire the aviation business of Jet.AI in an all-stock transaction valued between $12-22 million. This strategic acquisition aims to augment flyExclusive's growth and market share, leveraging synergies as both companies operate Textron Aviation and HondaJet aircraft. The deal, which includes a $50 million non-binding term sheet with Hexstone Capital LP for Jet.AI's financing, is expected to close in the second quarter of 2025, pending regulatory and shareholder approvals.
